object.name: sendVoice
object.description: Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .OGG file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as Audio or Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send voice messages of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
object.html_description: Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .OGG file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as Audio or Document). On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send voice messages of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.
object.rst_description: Use this method to send audio files, if you want Telegram clients to display the file as a playable voice message. For this to work, your audio must be in an .OGG file encoded with OPUS (other formats may be sent as :class:`aiogram.types.audio.Audio` or :class:`aiogram.types.document.Document`). On success, the sent :class:`aiogram.types.message.Message` is returned. Bots can currently send voice messages of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format :code:`@channelusername`)
annotations.name: chat_id

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only
annotations.name: message_thread_id

annotations.description: Audio file to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files
annotations.html_description: Audio file to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files »
annotations.rst_description: Audio file to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. :ref:`More information on Sending Files Â» <sending-files>`
annotations.name: voice

annotations.description: Voice message caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.html_description: Voice message caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.rst_description: Voice message caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.name: caption

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.html_description: Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.rst_description: Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details.
annotations.name: parse_mode

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse_mode*
annotations.name: caption_entities

annotations.description: Duration of the voice message in seconds
annotations.html_description: Duration of the voice message in seconds
annotations.rst_description: Duration of the voice message in seconds
annotations.name: duration

annotations.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.html_description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.rst_description: Sends the message `silently <https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages>`_. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
annotations.name: disable_notification

annotations.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.html_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.rst_description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving
annotations.name: protect_content

annotations.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.html_description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.rst_description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message
annotations.name: reply_to_message_id

annotations.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.html_description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found
annotations.name: allow_sending_without_reply

annotations.type: InlineKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardMarkup or ReplyKeyboardRemove or ForceReply
annotations.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
annotations.html_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
annotations.rst_description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an `inline keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards>`_, `custom reply keyboard <https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards>`_, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.
annotations.name: reply_markup
